captions.text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I am going to share
with you a cupcake recipe.

We are making a cannoli cupcake, now I could
not think of a better recipe to end the year
of on than a cannoli cupcake.

Cupcakes are something, that you guys know
I absolutely love and a connoli is something

else I love but combing these two together
just seems to be the right thing to do.

So I am really excited to share this recipe
with you its so simple and so easy, hopefully

you can make it for your New Year's Eve get
together because they are just that simple
and easy.

Let me take you over to the ingredients so
we can get this thing started.

You will need all purpose flour, baking powder,
some salt, granulated sugar, eggs, Vanilina,

which you could also use some vanilla extract,
whole milk, an orange and some unsalted butter

that has been softened at room temperature,
I already have mine in my standing mixer so

we can get this thing started. It is just
so good.

Now this is the case for the cupcake then
I will show you the filling then I will show
you the topping.

Now I am adding orange to the batter because
a traditional cannoli has candied orange peel

running through the filling, I did not want
to do that, I wanted to keep the filling really

nice and smooth and give the orange hint a
little bit in the filling and most of it in

the base, like in the cupcake it self. You
can totally leave that out if you want to,i

just think it makes thing taste incredible
so I am going to keep it in there.

In here I have got some of my unsalted butter,
softened at room temperature, I am going to

make mine in my standing mixer just because
its nice and easy and I am going to cream

that together till it is really well combined
then I am going to take my dry ingredients

with my Vanilina, and I am going to mix that
together.

Now Vanilina is just an Italian powdered vanilla
but you can use vanilla extract in its place
and it would be fantastic.

So I am going to add some right in there and
then just mix it with my spatula to combine,
just quickly.

I am going to add the eggs, also I am going
to zest pretty much the whole orange because

you will need a couple teaspoons of orange
zest and the juice of half an orange right

in to my milk just because its really nice
and easy.

That's good enough, set that aside, lets check
on my butter and egg mixture, just make sure
you give everything a stir from the bottom.
That looks good, alright get off my spatula!

Alright, I am going to add my dry ingredients
right in there like so.

And then I am going to lift this up and as
this mixes I am going to pour in my orange
and milk mixture.
That looks perfect.

Okay, now using one of my best friends in
the entire world, the handy ice cream scoop,

I am going to divide my batter nice and even
because I want all the cupcakes to be the

same size, which is why I love using an ice
cream scoop for this.

Last one, I managed to pretty much get every
single little bit out of that bowl. Now these

are going to go into your pre-heated oven
at 350F between 18 and 20 Minuets just keep

an eye on them you will know when they are
cooked when you take a tooth pick insert it

into the center, if it comes out clean with
no wet batter then you know they are done

then they need to cool completely before we
get going on filling and topping them.

My cupcakes baked for exactly 18 minuets I
let them cool completely and now all I have

done is I have taken this really little ice
cream scoop, I am pretty sure I have an obsession

with and ice cream scoop because I have all
different sizes but that's okay because they

are really handy, all I did is I just took
mine and I just made a little indent right

in the center like that, remove that and then
I hollow out just a little bit more using

the ice cream scoop because it is just easy
and then I have been eating the entire filling,
well the inside.

So, in here - excuse me I have a cupcake in
my mouth - In here I am going to have powdered

sugar a touch of cocoa powder. I am going
to add a little bit of vanilla paste and you

can use vanilla extract if you want to I think
vanilla past makes all the difference it is
just so delicious, I love it.
Now for the important part, ricotta.

If you can go into an Italian deli and get
a really fresh thing of ricotta, where it's

nice and thick and fabulous that you can use
right away, I did not go into an Italian market

I went to my regular supermarket and bought
ricotta there.

It's a little bit too loose, so what you do
is the same thing I do with my ricotta when

I make my cannoli, I put it through - I put
a little, this is a coffee filter actually

you can use paper towel, you can use a piece
of cloth it is completely up to you.

I put that into a sieve and then in there
I put my ricotta, put a little bit of paper

towel on top and I sit it just like this over
a bowl in the fridge overnight.

What that does is, all the liquid from the
ricotta will drain through the ricotta and

go right into to the bowl, now I already discarded
most of my liquid so there is nothing in here

for you to see, now what I have got is really
thick ricotta that is not going to ooze out

everywhere, it is really going to keep a nice
texture, so what I am going to do now is take

my ricotta, look how thick that is, that is
exactly what I am looking for.

And I am just going to mix that with powdered
sugar and my cocoa, now the reason why I like

to add just a teaspoon of coca powder to this
is because I am not going to be adding any

mini chocolate chips to this I am going to
add some chocolate curls on the top, but I

want a little bit more bite of the bite of
the chocolate and if you want, at this point

you can add a little bit of orange zest, or
a little candied orange peel, I am not going

to I am really happy with the flavor of the
orange that is in the cupcake base.

So I am going to just keep this as is and
I am going to give it a really good mix, until
everything is really nice and combined.
Perfect.

Then I just take the ice cream scoop and I
just pop a couple little scoops of my filling

right in there, and how perfect is that, that
is why I like using my ice cream scoop or

a melon baller for this because it is just
- I don't know I just feel like it make my

job a lot easier, so I am just going to fill
these up and then we will get ready to make
the topping.

Once you have got those all filled it is time
to make some sweetened whipped cream, what

I have got here is some heavy cream and I
am just going to add a touch of vanilla extract

to this, you can also add your vanilla paste
if you want to, just going to add a small

splash just to give it a really good flavor
and then I am going to use my hand mixer here,

to whisk this until its like nice soft peaks
then we will add in our powdered sugar.

This is thick enough, I am going to add my
powdered sugar and then whisk this till it

has got nice thick peaks but not to stiff
that its turns into butter.

That look good enough I am going to move this
right over here for know and I have got a

zip lock bag which you can use on any piping
bag you want - there is a crumb in there from

when I hollowed out the cupcakes, I fitted
it with a large star tip and I am going to

put some of this whipped cream, do not know
if I can fit all of it but we shall try.

I am am going to put that in there because
I am to just -look at that I did manage, now

lets hope it does not explode from over filling
but there is only one way to find out!
Alright, beautiful, perfectly whipped.
Okay lets see.

Take these closer to me and I am just going
to top them like so. I am not going to do

too, too much whipped cream because there
is a lot of sweetness going on, got a lot

of layers and now I am going to be honest
and say that yes, normally I would not go

through this much trouble for a cupcake but
when it is worth it, you know I am doing it
so cannoli cupcake you are worth every bite.
That is good enough.
The rest is for me.

Now you can serve this just like that and
it would be gorgeous or top them with mini

chocolate chips, that would be delicious as
well.

What I am going to do is I am going to take
a bar chocolate this is some dark chocolate,

I am going to push this close to me and take
in a really big knife I am going to pull back,

this just gives me little chocolate curls,
that I just think looks so darling on top

of the cupcakes it makes it look a bit more
fancy.

But as we all know I should say, complicated
is just not my forte so if I could make something
fancy and also be very easy, count me in.
These, to me, look incredible.

Now, if you really want to take things up
just another little notch, buy these little

mini cannoli shells at your local supermarket,
they have them right in the baking isle - like

where the, if your supermarket carries fresh
baked goods they will have them right in he

fresh baked good section and you can either
make extra filing and fill each one so your

guests get a cannoli in a cupcake or you can
take each one and sit it right on top and

that just - I think anyway - takes things
to a whole new level.
I mean that to me, is a showstopper.

Now, of course you could do all of the cannoli
shells on top of each one, I am going to leave

four for now, if you wanted to make things
even more special you can make extra filling,

you know fill the cannoli shell with it and
then that way, you guests will get a mini
cannoli and a cupcake, yum.

I am going for this one because it has got
the most chocolate, but its going to be the
messiest to eat.
That's okay!
I will bear it for you, do not worry.

I am so excited I don't know what to do with
my self.
look at the filling.
There are no words to how good this is.
The balance of flavor,
The moist and flavorful cake base.
It is just a winner in every single way.

If you really want to impress your guests,
go to Laurainthekitchen.com get the recipe,

make these, because they are not difficult
to make - a bit more involved, but anything
special like this is worth it.

I hope you enjoyed spending time with me,
if you make these you know I want to see a
picture in Intstagram, twitter and facebook!

I've been seeing tons of your pictures lately,
and I've been absolutely loving them.

So, I hope you have been enjoying spending
time with me and I will see you in the next
one.
Happy New Year!
Bye bye!

title: Cannoli Cupcakes Recipe - Laura Vitale - Laura in the Kitchen Episode 700

comments.text:
1 (18.25 ounce) package white cake mix
 1 cup all-purpose flour
 1 cup white sugar
 3/4 teaspoon salt
 1 1/3 cups water
 1 cup sour cream
 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
 1 teaspoon almond extract
 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
 4 egg whites
hopefully you dont add too much of the alomnd extract because it is a lot 
stronger than the vanilla extract
+Beatriz Corbetta Reis
